page.title: 07Limekilns and Enclosure.
page.content: There are two disused limekilns in this square. This provides evidence that this land is sited on limestone rock. The lime was taken to other areas to be used for fertiliser. This industry had an obvious influence on the area as a nearby wood is named Limekiln Wood. Also in this area is an Iron Age land enclosure. This was later taken over by the Romans. Attempts to gain access to this were denied as barbed wire had been put across the Public Footpath. Intusion into this area was obviously actively discouraged as there was an abundance of prohibitive notices.
